name: Bahia Principe Costa Adeje

reviews.text: I loved this hotel! The pool's are fantastic, the food is fantastic and the booze is free flowing and a part is self-service, not that their shy about giving you a large amount of booze. I will definately be returning in the future to this hotel. There is a taxi rank outside if you wish to visit Playa de las Americas, or Los Cristianos, there is also a bus that stops outside the reception. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Anybody travelling to this hotel, have a fantastic holiday!!

I would advise anyone to give this hotel a visit. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here which was shared with my husband, 5 year old daughter and 7 month baby boy. reviews.text: On our arrival we thought we were booked into the Costa adeje hotel as viewed in our direct holidays brochure. We spoke to reception who were willing to move us once we had looked around the hotel and grounds. After looking we soon realised that the Tenerife Hotel was far more suited for us as we have a baby in a pram. Costa adeje has numerious stairs to get to pools and facilities. It is accessable, but hard work with the lifting. Guests have use of both hotels which are directly beside each other.

Eating was a pleasure, with an excellent variety for even the fussiest eaters in the main buffet resturant ( Champagne and Caviar at breakfast ). Also included in your all inclusive package was 3 meals per week in various themed resturants (Aisian, Mexican & italian). I would advise booking these 2 or more days in advance to ensure you get times and the day you wish.
reviews.title: A bit out of the way but worth it

reviews.text: I would advise anyone going here with a baby that requires bottle feeds to bring your own travel kettle and washing up liquid with you. Shops in the complex did not sell washing up liquid and the rooms focused on the mini bar, so no kettle. I was only able to hire a kettle a day and a half into our stay as they had all been hired out ( 25 Euros for fortnight).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is fantastic, choice of restaurants is great with each one giving good quality food. The choice of drinks on the all-inclusive package is superb, from beer through to cocktails. The place is amazingly clean, there seems to be a small army of cleaners and gardeners that are always doing something. The atmosphere is good, the staff are friendly and always willing to help and answer any questions that you may have. The only negative is that there simply isn't enough places to sit outside and that there is really only one bar in the main hotel that you can use in the evening. We found ourselves hanging around waiting for a table, most people seem to eat very early to ensure that they get a table.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the downside: This hotel is about 7K from Las Americas and situated in what I would describe as an unattractive area. Outside the hotel on oneside is a large gully, on the other side is rough ground leading down to the sea. There appears to be no beaches in the immediate area. That said we have been lucky enough to have stayed in Riu, Iberostar, and Bahia Principe hotels in Europe and the Caribbean. This is the best we have been in. It is a large hotel built on terraces down to the sea. The gardens are very attractive, running down from the reception area to the sea. The pools are set out in the garden area and include an infinity pool looking over the sea. The food is very, very good. and include an Asian, Seafood, Spanish and Italian restruarants which can be visited three times during a weeks stay. Service is excellent and as much wine as you wish. The rooms are large and clean. I would suspect people with walking difficulties may find problems with the slopes, however there are ramps and all areas of the hotel can be reached by lifts. Las Americas can be reached via a bus from the hotel for 5 Euros return, the morning run is at 9.30am and returns at 1pm. The afternoon run is at 12 noon returning at 6pm. A local bus service also connects to LA and other parts of the Island. Entertainment is better then average you can chose between the usual show type in the main square or small bands on the terraces. The accomadation is painted in bright colours giving the impression of an Italian village. Overall a very good hotel with friendly staff.

reviews.text: Our third visit to BP and once again we were not disappointed. There had actually been quite a few changes since our last visit, some for the better and some not so good.
reviews.title: Still excellent
First Class Hotel
reviews.text: It seems that a lot of the 'rules' about visiting different restaurants have been relaxed - you still have to book the a la carte restaurants, but there is none of this swapping 2 in the Adeje hotel for one in the Tenerife hotel going on any more. Only the buffet restaurants are 'out of bounds' to guests from the other hotel, and while we were there we spoke to a family for whom this had also been relaxed because their party was split across the two hotels.

Some of the restaurants have also changed their offerings - we were particularly impressed with the Spanish restaurant in the evening. It is all now waiter service, and we had some of the best steaks we have had in ages. The cheese and fruit dessert was also fantastic! All the rest were also very good (esp Asian and Seafood), but we liked the Spanish the best.
reviews.title: superb hotel,excellent facilities ,recommended to All!!!

reviews.text: The beach has also been considerably developed, and was our new favourite place to spend our days. They have put in some thatched sunshades, showers and a beach bar with seating area which is manned for much of the day. They also play some nice chill-out music down there, which creates a lovely ambience. The man in the beach bar would go round a couple of times a day and pick up anything that washed in, so it was always fairly clean and tidy, and he would also set up sunbeds and the like for you. Few of the other guests bothered to go down there (it was down quite a steep hill, and there were no loos down there, so you had to plan ahead if you know you are going to go), so at times there were only 10-12 people on the beach which meant that it was lovely and quiet. We also two or three times were able to watch whales just off the beach (one time they were really jumping) which really added something special.

reviews.text: The only things that had not improved centred around the entertainment. There were a few new members of the animation team, one in particular of which was particularly annoying. She was rather too loud and over-pushy in trying to get you to take part in things until I told her in no uncertain terms to leave us alone. That said, some of the daytime activities were excellent, including the water polo and aqua aerobics.

first experience of all inclusive and would definately recommend this hotel complex. Food good and varied. reviews.title: Excellent hotel.
Not a Four Star Rating in my opinion!
reviews.text: I have just returned with my husband from our first all inclusive holiday at the Bahia Principe and I have to say I will not be booking again. I will bullet point the main reasons for my low recommendation of this hotel.

1. Location - the hotel is located on an outcrop of land between costa adeje and playa paraiso. The road to the hotel is unlit and unmarked and the bus and taxi drivers use it as a rally course. You can only walk to playa paraiso from the hotel which is a bit up and down and a good 20-30mins walk and even out here you are pestered by touts - they stalk you in cars! The bus only runs 3 times a day to Las Americas with the latest outward journey 1pm and the latest return 5pm not great if you want to spend a day or night out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent All Round Hotel
Loved It!!!
reviews.text: 2. Service - The service in general is ok. The public relations girls were as efficient as possible however they were unable to cope with the large amount of people booking restuarants and excursions, thus resulting in us waiting 40 mins to be served and then being booked into restuarants at times that were not what we had wished for. Check in and Check out were extremely busy and nobody waits in line.

3.Cleanliness - the cleanliness of the hotel in general was to a reasonably high standard however pigeons in the restuarants and dining areas and in particular the snack bar at the pool where they used the pool to wash, drink and poo was just disgusting!
